summary: Daniel Flores was a CIA employee. The documents indicate his employment with the CIA from at least 1962 to 1975. He swore an oath to support the Constitution and denied subversive activities in 1962. In 1975, the CIA's General Counsel requested that he be excused from jury duty, citing a special category of employees. A supplemental personal history statement from 1974 provides personal details such as his date and place of birth, marital status, spouse's information, residences, children, relatives living abroad, and personal declarations. He was also involved in the transfer of AMMUG to a new apartment in Silver Springs, Maryland in 1964.
significance: The significance of Daniel Flores in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. His CIA employment and the agency's efforts to shield him from jury duty suggest he may have held a sensitive position. Further research would be needed to determine if his role had any connection to the JFK assassination.
